intro: Ligusticum angustilobum, commonly known as narrow-lobed Chinese angelica, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels. Its roots are often used in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported health benefits. The botanical characteristics of Ligusticum angustilobum make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
